Holy shit, this game broke my heart, but I loved it so much! Although the gameplay was good, I beat it in 2 days, so, it's a short game. Get during a steam sale if you want to play it.

Remember Bioshock?  The wonderfully abysmal atmosphere that made you fear what was around the next corner, or maybe when you heard a splicer crawling around the environment, looting it the same as you?  Or when you first ran into that big daddy, and perhaps he triggered one of your traps that was meant for a splicer, and an epic fight ensued?  Remember all the breath-taking environments you could explore freely and learn more about and become interested in, with memorable characters like Cohen or Andrew Ryan?  Didn't you just love the feel of adding a new weapon to your arsenal and slowly personalizing it with upgrades, and taking pictures of enemies to study them and find out their weaknesses, or using the environment to your advantage in combat with your powers, which you bought and upgraded through the use of ADAM, which carried a sense of weight to your choices when you finally captured a little sister and decided what you'd do with her?

Yea, Bioshock Infinite has none of that.

[h1]OVERALL SCORE[/h1]
Highly not recommended

[h1]REPLAY VALUE[/h1]
Slight
Vklidu :p

Hay veces que juegas a un  juego y te deja indiferente. Hay otras en las que te diviertes y ya esta. Pero hay veces, que el juego te marca, no vuelves a ser el mismo una vez se ha acabado y te deja un enseñanza mayor de la que mucha gente hoy día podría dar, y este es un caso. No diré palabras sobre el juego puesto que ha ser disfrutado por primera vez, dejar que te sumerja dentro de sus profundidades o alturas, y sin duda alguna el DLC Burial at Sea son indisspensables para acabar de sorprenderte de lo que es capaz de hacer una buenisima historia.En resumen si no has oído hablar de esta obra de arte o no la has jugado, sin dudarlo un momento merece la pena 100%. Fun gameplay. Battles are quite fluid and dynamic, as you can use a combination of offensive or defensive firearms, melee attacks, vigors, transdimensional assists and the fast-moving sky-line. The enemy AI is not very smart though, they tend to simply charge you and they are quite tanky.

You also manage an in-game currency to purchase supplies and weapons/vigors upgrades, and have access to a multitude of character upgrades. All these choices felt a bit overwhelming on my casual playthrough (15 hrs on hard), and the game should have good replay value.

The story is very good. The first 2 hrs were quite boring, but once you connect with Elizabeth (who has a pretty convincing AI), the pace picks up nicely and it was hard to stop playing. The finale however is disappointing; it's overly long and not exactly transparent: [spoiler] it seems to be based on a time-travel paradox which IMO is a bit cliché [/spoiler].

It's too bad that you are limited to two firearms since there is a great variety of them. And the checkpoint saving system is simply terrible; they are often 15 minutes apart, with no quicksaves!

Un juego con una historia maravillosa, no es necesario pasarse el 1 o el 2 pero para entender a fondo la historia, y entender porque muchos (yo incluido) calificamos a este juego como obra maestra, una historia de esas que no dejas de pensar en la misma por unos dias, y luego vas a recordar a este juego por el resto de tu vida, la historia parece muy sencilla, hasta que te das cuenta de lo que en realidad significa todo lo que haz hecho.

Cosas buenas:
Historia Increiblemente buena
Buenos graficos, principalmente las expresiones faciales.
Variedad de armas y tónicos
Variedad de mecanicas únicas de combate
Banda sonora excelente, no solo es muy buena la banda sonora, sino también da un ambiente perfecto a los lugares.
Probablemente el mejor juego de la década
Cosas malas:
A decir verdad, el unico fallo que le encontre es el hecho de que es casi requerido jugar en dificil como mínimo, debido a que en medio y facil las mecanicas que implementa el juego no son necesarias para llegar al final.

I can't bring myself to finish this game. It's something I dream about at night and I really want to play it but I do not want to finish it, not yet. 
This game has an amazing atmosphere, not the dark and gritty atmosphere from the first 2 games but a light, airy, colorful and simply incredible atmosphere.  The story, the weapons, the enemies, all the aspects of the game just saomehow fit together in this game. It's a piece of art in my opinion. It 's worth the full price but it's often on sales and it'll save you over 50% if you get it then. Anyway, I highly recommend this game for any price. 
I'll finish this game, I have it installed on my pc and it winks at me everyday, I just don't want to finish it, not yet.

一开始便被画面震撼到了，冲着口碑去买，显然没让我失望，虽然破解版一大堆，但是真的是该支持下开放团队，这年头这样的游戏不多了，剧情无可挑剔，战斗的代入感也很强，不会像其他射击游戏一样，让你玩了一章节后不想继续下去了。还有就是剧情，伊丽莎白的存在，深深感染了玩家（我相信不只是我，所有喜欢这游戏的都会爱上伊丽莎白这样的角色）。本来就悲剧性的角色，再加上开发团队已经解散，真的很令人惋惜。因此买了这款游戏，并评测，虽然已无济于事，喜欢就买吧。几顿吃饭前而已，真的不希望这样的悲剧在发生。
Love this game and the whole series. Amazing story, I like how it connects to the first game in Burial At Sea.

I jumped into this game knowing I would get a fun and colorful FPS. Boy was I right! The graphics are amazing in Colombia and I loved every step I took in the geourgeous world. As for the game mechanics, the sky line was a great way to travel around the city. I was able to use it to my advantage many times. But combat on the sky line was difficult as you are always in motion. The story was good too and I always felt emmersed in the game. If you are at all interested in FPSs or gaming in general then pick this up! You won't be dissapointed!

Titubante davanti ad un Bioshock senza Rapture mi sono addentrato nei meandri di Columbia scoprendo che quel geniaccio di Ken Levine era riuscito a creare qualcosa di altrettanto sublime. Prima di tutto Columbia è qualcosa di PAZZESCO, una gioia per gli occhi e quasi al livello dell'inarrivabile Rapture. Quando aprite questo gioco staccate il tasto F12 dalla tastiera se non volete martellarlo a forza di screenshot. Arriviamo dunque alla storia, beh...non ci capirete quasi nulla se non alla fine, ma una volta concluso il gioco consiglio a chiunque di prendere i DLC Burial at Sea pt.1 e pt.2 poiché chiudono un cerchio come quello della saga di Bioshock. Dunque giocatelo ed innamoratevi di Elizabeth, miglior compagna d'avventure mai avuta nelle mie esperienze videoludiche.

Voici quelques détails sur mon expérience de jeu sur Bioshock Infinite.

J'ai passé une quinzaine d'heures pour terminer à mon aise l'histoire principale. Les dlc (hors Carnage Celeste) se terminent facilement en 2h chacun. Autant dire que la durée de vie du jeu n'est pas longue mais suffisante à vous divertir comme il se doit. Je l'ai terminé en difficile (mais vraiment sans aucun accro). Un mode 1999 se débloque ensuite mais je ne l'ai pas testé.

L'histoire est captivante mais au fur et à mesure de l'avancement du jeu ont peut très vite s'apercevoir que les raccourcis scénaristiques se multiplient (malheureusement). Les dlc nous donnent une vision plus fine et quelques détails supplémentaires que l'histoire principale n'a pas su nous fournir directement mais tout n'est pas mis en lumière et beaucoup de choses restent dans le flou.

L'ambiance générale est très bonne, les graphismes sont très bons également (même s'ils sont un peu trop saturés et que le flare est présent en abondance) et on s'amuse rapidement à faire quelques screenshots sympathiques pour notre bibliothèque. Les scènes dans le jeu sont vraiment très belles.

Le gameplay global est assez répétitif et ne donne pas l'occasion au joueur d'aller plus loin que le couloir déjà tracé vers les objectifs (pas assez d'exploration). C'est bourrin (même si les armes ne sont pas des engins de siège) et certains sorts sont juste abusés (je pense au Plasmide Hiver d'Antan des dlc qui vous donne le pouvoir de geler les enemis pour ensuite leur mettre un coup et les faire exploser...). D'autres sorts sont par contre totalement inutiles... Les enemis ne sont pas très évolués et trop peu nombreux en types. Je regrette également le fait qu'il n'y ait pas de vrai boss dans le jeu. L'utilisation des failles est pratique mais pas indispensable et surtout pas assez exploitée. 

Au final je le recommande dans le sens où je suis certain que vous passerez un bon moment.
Do not recommend.

There will be many superlatives in my review. But be warned, there are also some little things that I didn't like.

Bioshock Infinite is a visual masterpiece. I'm not talking about the cutting edge graphics, I'm talking about the artistic style. I love how everything is huge; the buildings, the statues made of pure gold, the gigantic doorways. I love looking into the starry  sky. Don't get me started about the moment when I saw a glipse of Manhattan burning. I love how they captured the early 20th century feeling. I always imagine the pre-1914 era as a careless time, when people were enjoying their sunday picnic in the park or sunbathing at the beach. Bioshock captures that very feeling. The soundtrack is one of the best ever. Hall of heroes with different movements from Mozart's Requiem beginning with "Lacrimosa" and climaxing in "Confutatis" is maybe the best moment in video game history. W.A himself would be very proud of that scene!

Now the things that I didn't like about Bioshock Infinite. The story was galloping at the speed of light and left me clueless from the very beginning. Who's Slate? Who's Comstock? What are all these dimensions? Is it time traveling? What exactly is the debt that DeWitt is constantly reminded of? There are some crumbs of information in these short voxophone and kinetoscope recordings, but I probably wasn't paying enough attention to them at 4 o' clock in the morning. After the ending I was more clueless than I was in the beginning. I guess this is a game  you have to play through more than once.  Another thing that I didn't like so much was the shooter mechanics. It resembled a 1990's playstation arcade shooter. Shoot em all and advance to the next level all over again.

But summa summarum, this game is art at its purest form. I would recommend it to literature and art fans, but not so much to FPS fans.

The best game in the series I was sort of new to the bioshock series before I played BSI I had played maybe a handfull of hours of BS1 when I had Gamefly and they used to offer some games for free while you were a subscriber. Tho my pc settup then was primarly the reason why I didnt finsh BS1 kept crashing after random times in the game.  So I gave up on Bioshock.  I got this game on a steam sale heard alot about it remembered G4TV's review of it and thought I'd give it a try. I was pleasntly surprised prob one of the best shooters Ive ever played thought the story line was very interesting and engaging and the gameplay was top notch kept making me want to come back and play. Something else I wasnt used to in a shooter was the horror element it reminded me of the way Doom 3 used to make me feel. I enjoyed this game makes me wish I wouldve played the Bioshock series sooner. Looking forward to the next installment.

本作は高い評価を受けたバイオショックシリーズの三作目になる。
物語性とアクション性を求めるなら本作は両方を十二分に満たした傑作だ。
FPS好きならもちろん、これからFPSを始める人にもオススメしたい。

豪華キャストによる日本語吹き替えもばっちりなので、言語の壁を気にすることもない。
DLCに関しても過去のアップデートで日本語吹き替えが追加され、全てが日本語でプレイが可能となった。

物語は過去二作の海底都市から一転し、空中都市コロンビアが舞台となる。
本編じたいは過去作をプレイしていなくても問題なくプレイが可能だ。
冒頭は借金を帳消しにするため依頼内容の娘を探しにコロンビアを訪れるところから物語は始まる。
伏線は序盤から大量に配置されているので、2週目ではいろんな発見もあるだろう。
考察を見ないと難解な物語だが、理解してみればこれはすごいと言ってしまう内容だ。

肝心のアクションに関してだが、過去作同様プラスミド（ビガー）と銃器でイケイケドンドンなプレイが出来る。難易度ハードでは上級者でもやり応えのあるプレイが楽しめるだろう。かといって理不尽といえるような場所もなくゲームバランスはかなりいい。
追加されたアクションやプラスミドも多く新鮮な気持ちでバイオショックを一から楽しめた印象だ。

グラフィックに関してはDirectX11による描画は見事としか言いようがない。背景の美しさに胸うたれること必死である。そして相変わらず水の描画はすばらしい。

総評として、褒めるところは多数有れど、けなすところがほとんど見当たらない。傑作という言葉がしっくりくる作品となっている。元々完成度の高いシリーズだったが、本作で完成されたと言っても過言ではない。未プレイなら今すぐプレイするべき作品だ。是非ともオススメしたい。

最後にDLCに関してだが、「Burial at Sea - Episode Two」の内容がバイオショック1をプレイ済み前提となっているので、あらかじめ１の物語を知っておく必要がある。
本作含めてバンドルで買ってしまうのもありだろう。

It seems like 2013 was the year of freaking amazing games. I just bought this recently during a sale when it was $5, but boy oh boy do I regret not playing it when it released. This game is worth buying full price, and if I could I would pay 20 bucks if I knew how great it would be. Being the 3rd of the series in BioShock, Infinite brings us to a whole different dimension where we look into the life of Booker DeWitt. I don't want to spoil anything, but being my BioShock game I played, I really enjoyed the combat and nice storyline. The different weapons and vigor system was also very fun to play around with. One thing they could've fixed was adding a bow to the game, but my carbine rifle was enough to give me the joy of headshots :D
TL:DR 10/10 >------>BOWS RULES! <-------<
